text: OK, then definsible (except for for the stuff I do, `epsilon` is largely reserved for other purposes, some of which I absolutely dtest.  For example, lots of macroeconomists use `epsilon` as the symbol for individual wage.... oh wait, I should move that to gripes).

text: No that makes perfect sense. `epsilon` is the symbol traditionally used for arbitrarily small amounts after all :wink:

text: Good point.  So there should be a markov chain where when you leave grad school the symbol changes from an epsilon to a euro or dollar sign.
